instruction: Rinse the jeerakasala rice 2–3 times until the water runs clear. Soak it in water for 30 minutes.
title: Soak Jeerakasala Rice

transcript_segments.text: Hello everyone! Welcome back to another video. I'm Priscila Benjamin. When it comes to biryani, almost every region has its own variety. Today, I'm sharing a Kerala special — Thalassery Biryani. The taste is incredible, so let’s get started and check out the recipe!

For this recipe, I’ve taken 2 glasses of Jeerakasala rice, also known as Kaima rice. Wash and soak it for 10 minutes. I’ve also taken 1 kg of chicken. For better flavor, I’m going to marinate the chicken. To that, add some salt.
Add 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp chilli powder, 1 tsp pepper powder, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, and 2 tbsp curd. Mix it all together and let it rest for 30 minutes.

instruction: Heat oil in a pan. Add thinly sliced onions and shallow-fry on medium heat until golden brown. Remove and drain on paper towels.
title: Fry Onions for Garnishing

transcript_segments.text: Next, for frying — in a pan, add 1 tsp ghee and 4 tbsp oil. Once it heats up, add thinly sliced onions and fry them until light golden brown. Once fried, remove and set aside. In the same oil, fry cashew nuts and raisins.

instruction: In the same or a separate pan, heat ghee and sauté cashews until golden. Add raisins and sauté until they puff up. Set aside for garnishing.
title: Sauté Cashews and Raisins

transcript_segments.text: Next, for frying — in a pan, add 1 tsp ghee and 4 tbsp oil. Once it heats up, add thinly sliced onions and fry them until light golden brown. Once fried, remove and set aside. In the same oil, fry cashew nuts and raisins.

Once they are golden and puffed, remove and set aside. In a pot, add 4 glasses of water — for 2 glasses of rice. Add whole spices like bay leaf, cloves, and cardamom, plus salt and ½ tsp ghee. Let it come to a boil.

instruction: In a bowl, mix chicken with a little salt and turmeric. Let it sit for about 10 minutes.
title: Marinate Chicken Lightly

transcript_segments.text: Once they are golden and puffed, remove and set aside. In a pot, add 4 glasses of water — for 2 glasses of rice. Add whole spices like bay leaf, cloves, and cardamom, plus salt and ½ tsp ghee. Let it come to a boil.
Once the water starts boiling, add the soaked rice. Mix, cover with a lid, and cook. Once the rice is done, set it aside. Now let’s prepare the chicken masala. In a kadai, add 3 tsp ghee.

instruction: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add the marinated chicken and sear on high heat until the outside is lightly browned.
title: Sear the Chicken

transcript_segments.text: Once the water starts boiling, add the soaked rice. Mix, cover with a lid, and cook. Once the rice is done, set it aside. Now let’s prepare the chicken masala. In a kadai, add 3 tsp ghee.

instruction: Lower the heat and add ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until raw smell disappears. Add green chilies and chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes soften.
title: Add Aromatics and Tomatoes

transcript_segments.text: Once hot, add whole spices — a small piece of cinnamon, cardamom, bay leaf, star anise, and cloves. Sauté for a few minutes. Add 3 thinly sliced onions and salt. Sauté until they turn light brown.
Add 1½ tsp ginger-garlic paste and 2 tsp green chilli paste. Adjust chillies according to your spice level. Sauté well.
Add ¼ tsp nutmeg powder, ½ tsp pepper powder, 1½ tsp chicken masala, and 1 tsp biryani masala. Sauté until the raw smell disappears. Then, add 2 sliced tomatoes and mix well.
Add a little water and cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.

instruction: Mix in red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Stir well. Add yogurt and cook until the masala thickens and coats the chicken.
title: Add Spices and Yogurt

transcript_segments.text: Now, add the marinated chicken. Mix well and cook for about 10 minutes.

instruction: Cover the pan and cook the chicken on low heat until tender and fully cooked. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
title: Simmer Chicken Until Cooked

transcript_segments.text: Now, add the marinated chicken. Mix well and cook for about 10 minutes.

instruction: In a separate large vessel, bring ample water to a boil. Add whole spices, salt, and a few drops of oil.
title: Boil Water with Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: Now, add the marinated chicken. Mix well and cook for about 10 minutes.

instruction: Add the soaked rice to the boiling water. Cook until 90% done – the grains should be soft but still firm in the center. Drain and set aside.
title: Cook the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Now, add the marinated chicken. Mix well and cook for about 10 minutes.

instruction: In a deep pot, spread the cooked chicken masala at the bottom. Layer half of the cooked rice on top.
title: Layer Chicken and Rice

transcript_segments.text: Once the chicken masala is ready, add some crushed fried onions and chopped coriander leaves. Mix everything together.
Now let’s dum cook the biryani. In a thick-bottomed pot, first add a little ghee. Then spread a layer of chicken masala evenly. Next, add a layer of cooked rice and spread it evenly.

instruction: Sprinkle half of the chopped mint, coriander, fried onions, and lemon juice over the rice layer.
title: Add Herbs and Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: On top, add some fried onions, cashew nuts, coriander leaves, and mint leaves. Sprinkle some garam masala powder and drizzle a few drops of ghee.

instruction: Add the remaining rice as the second layer. Top with the rest of the mint, coriander, and fried onions.
title: Repeat Layering

transcript_segments.text: Repeat the layering — chicken masala, coriander and mint leaves, followed by the remaining rice. Spread it evenly.
Add another layer of fried onions, coriander, and mint leaves. Sprinkle garam masala and add a few drops of ghee. I'm adding one more layer of chicken masala now.
Top with the remaining rice. Sprinkle some garam masala and fried onions.

instruction: Cover the pot with a tight lid or seal with dough. Place over very low heat and cook for 15–20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
title: Seal and Dum Cook

transcript_segments.text: Add cashew nuts, coriander, and mint leaves. Finally, drizzle a few drops of ghee. Cover the pot with aluminum foil. If you don’t have foil, seal the pot using wheat flour or maida dough. Dum it for 10 minutes.

instruction: Let the biryani rest for 10 minutes after dum. This helps settle the layers and enhance flavor.
title: Rest Before Serving

transcript_segments.text: After 10 minutes, open the pot — and there you go! Delicious Thalassery Biryani is ready to serve. The taste is incredible and it’s a must-try!
